I have been excommunicated for the sin of dishonorable murder.
Curses!
A courtier who has legitimate claims on one of my de jure vassals is requesting permission to move to my court. He obviously hopes that I will make use of his claims to expand my realm.
He is welcome!
[This.GetFirstName] will pack his bags and move to your court
No, I don't trust him
Opportunistic scoundrels are not welcome in my court
[From.GetFirstName] will not receive any further such requests
[From.GetFirstName] accepted my request to move to [From.GetHisHer] court.
I'm out of here!
[From.GetFirstName] has left my court to seek out a liege who he thinks will enforce his claims.
He's a fool
[From.GetFirstName] called me an opportunistic scoundrel who is not welcome at [From.GetHisHer] court. All I wanted was the lands that are rightfully mine!
Why, [From.GetFirstName], why?!
A papal bull has arrived demanding the return of Holy Rome to the Papacy.
Accept
Refuse
How can I be crowned if I am not the Emperor?
That's silly!
The unfortunate death of one of my prisoners has given me a reputation for tyranny.
That's unfair!
Lately, a handsome sargeant has been doing extra duty, taking shifts outside my bedchambers.  I think I read interest in his intense glances.
Tonight, I shall see if my instincts are correct.
Nothing good could come of my sinful desires.
I will gain a special friend to ease my loneliness
A punch in the face and scandal!
I was right.  These stolen moments of companionship and intimacy are well worth the risks to my honour and soul.  I will now be better able to concentrate on affairs of state.
A balm on my lonely heart.
How could I have been so wrong?
I must dismiss him from my guard.  Surely his word cannot stand against mine?
I must dismiss him from my guard. And buy his silence.
I was feeling restless and, despite the late hour, thought I would visit my husband for some conversation.  As I was about to knock, I realized he was not alone...and not with a woman!
Turn around quietly and pray you are mistaken.
Open the door and confront the pair.
We'll see what the scoundrel has to say!

My wife has caught us, fragrante delicto!  Gathering our clothes, I shoo my lover quickly out of the room and face my wife, with as much dignity as I can muster.  I stammer that I am sorry she had to find out...
But she'll have just have to put up with it.
And of course I'll send the man far away.

With our different stations, my lover and I have few chances to meet without arousing questions.  Fortunately, we can do so in the training yard, grappling and tousling, followed sometimes with a companiable drink in the hall.  And I get fitter to boot!
Ah! Fresh air and the clang of steel!
Sadly, the pressures of society have made our affair impossible to carry any longer.  I will cherish the times we had, but I must bid him farewell.
Alas, all good things must pass.
A young bard, stopping for the night, entertained us merrily at dinner.  It seemed to me though that the more ribald the song, the more he tried to catch my eye.

As it would be unseemly for my minstrel lover to settle here with me, he must continue to journey from castle to castle, from town to town.  But when he returns from his travels, he is always full of news.
Sweet pillow talk.
The master-at-arms believes my young son is ready for training with real weapons.  Has he grown up so fast?.
He's still too young.  Keep using wooden weapons.
Yes, it is time he faced real weapons.
My father ordered the master-at-arms to keep using wooden weapons as I practice my fighting skills.
Wood is best.  Steel look mean and sharp!
Darn, why can't he see I'm almost grown?
Use steel anyway.  I'm a grown man!
My father ordered the master-at-arms to switch to steel weapons as I practice my fighting skills.
I'm glad.  Steel look mean and sharp!
Run and hide until the lesson is done.
But...but, I might get hurt!
Despite months of efforts, the search for your family's heirloom shield has been fruitless.
Admit it is good and lost.
I know God frowns on sinners like me but the loneliness is unbearable.  Perhaps I could find a likeminded friend?
Let's see if my advances are welcome.
Nothing good can come of my sinful desires.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] tries to seduce [This.GetTitledFirstName]
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is clearly lonely and unfulfilled.  No wonder [From.GetSheHe] has started looking for like-minded companions...
Perhaps [From.GetSheHeCap] may be just what I need too...
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] encourages [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s advances
I cannot risk a relationship with [From.GetTitledFirstName]
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] scorns [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s advances
[From.GetTitledFirstName] responded to my advances and soon we were... engaging in a very stimulating activity. In short: the love-making was amazing!
I think I am in love...

The scorn I was met by when I tried to talk [From.GetTitledFirstName] into meeting me somewhere more private really hurt. [From.GetSheHeCap] actually laughed at my advances and told me I was both too old and too ugly for [From.GetHerHim].
I was taken aback by [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s scorn
My lover's standing at court is attracting jealousy and calumny.  I fear we must retreat if my vassals are to be appeased.
Dismiss him from office, but maintain the relationship.
Dismiss him and sever all ties.
Ignore the criticisms.
Much to my dismay, I fear that my member no longer obeys my wishes and refuses to rise!
This is most unfortunate.
Sharp pain in my big toe woke me.  Now my heels and knees are also lancing.  What is wrong with me?
Gout, the rich men's disease.
The Statute of Merton

The Statute of Merton or Provisions of Merton, sometimes also known as the Ancient Statute of Merton, is considered to be the first English statute, and is printed as the first statute in The Statutes of the Realm. Amongst its provisions, the statute allowed a Lord of the Manor to enclose common land (provided that sufficient pasture remained for his tenants), and set out when and how manorial lords could assert rights over waste land, woods, and pastures against their tenants.
It's for the greater good.
Quia Emptores

Quia Emptores was a statute that prevented tenants from alienating their lands to others by subinfeudation, instead requiring all tenants wishing to alienate their land to do so by substitution. Quia Emptores, along with its companion statute of Quo Warranto, was intended to remedy land ownership disputes and consequent financial difficulties that had resulted from the decline of the traditional feudal system during the High Middle Ages.
It's for the greater good.
My lover grew old and unattractive, I think it's time to leave the matter settle down and find confort in the other joys of life...
Indeed it is
But it's true love!
Jubilee

The concept of the Jubilee is a special year of remission of sins and universal pardon. In the Biblical Book of Leviticus, a Jubilee year is mentioned to occur every fifty years, in which slaves and prisoners would be freed, debts would be forgiven and the mercies of God would be particularly manifest. In Christianity, the tradition dates to 1300, following which ordinary jubilees have generally been celebrated every 25 or 50 years. Christian Jubilees, particularly in the Catholic tradition, generally involve pilgrimage to a sacred site, normally the city of Rome.
I'll be honoured to finance it and send a delegate
What is this stupid fair?
[From.GetName] has fallen! With the Mandylion hosted by one of the local temples, this could be an exceptional opportunity to get my hands on it..

For as long as have ruled here we Normans have entrusted the raising of our children to Saxon and Gaelic nursemaids. Our first words would not be Norman French but Saxon or Gaelic. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
Yes let us be one with our serfs

Around our lands more people are using this Scots language and I find this is a perfect means for a Norman overlord to get his Saxon and Gaelic serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.
We are indeed wise

Although every civilised man in Christendom knows that French is the true language of communication, this new Scots language does have a certain functionality. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
A most useful development

I was considering important business when I had an amazing insight. To strengthen my realm I must bring my vassals round to my way of thinking. This involves communication. If I can get them to communicate like me then I will have a much smoother running realm.
Sometimes I even surprise myself
My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Scottishness that is sweeping the realm.
Now, has anyone seen my kilt?
The Crusade was a great success, but to whom shall I grant the lands I have gained?
To my son
To a capable relative
To myself
To my brother
Inflicting misery on those around me no longer pleases me, I have lost the cruel trait.
My son is no longer soft and afraid, he has lost the craven trait.
In recognition of your glory and honor, a Lord offers to grant you knighthood.
Finally some recognition of my abilities, I shall be a famous knight!
Fuck you 'sires'!
May the great warriors guide my path!
You notice that a visiting knight has a squire with him, and you start thinking about offering your guardian your services as a squire...
Your ward offers his services as a squire...
Why not, a squire cannot hurt.
Buzz-off kid!
I am getting too old... I hear others mock me behind my back. Definitely too old to be a squire...
Pokes on them! ...and their kind!

The camp was attacked last night, it seems the besieged are getting desparate wiht their tactics. Most of the men were cought by surprise but not you... you were not only ready to fight, but rallied some men around you and exelled during the actuall fight. One of the knights present offer to Knight you on the spot!
The enemy is rooted! You rallied some men around you with your charisma and prowess and excelled during the last battle. One of the knights present offered to Knight you on the spot!
My guardian refused my squiering offer... Im flushed red with anger and shame, I can already hear some people mocking me behind my back
I'm really getting drilled by my Sire... Being a squire is hard, but it's the price to pay for glory!
My guardian took me as his squire!
Legends are full of great knights, but not all knights are true, and not all true knights are born of the nobility. You have been anointed a knight, and are thus permitted to bear the title 'Sire.'
I've been betrayed too many times. Why do I continue to place my trust in people who have done nothing to earn it?
I'll never let them hurt me again.

The defenders of [From.Siege.GetName] sallied forth but were caught unawares by some of the attackers. They lost many before limping back through the postern gate. There were great cheers from the attacking encampment.
Surrender comes sooner
The defenders of [From.Siege.GetName] were able to push back our last assault!
Alas!
We were able to breach the walls of [From.Siege.GetName] with our catapults and ballistas!
Grand!
The defenders of [From.Siege.GetName] were able to get some food and water with the help of a small scout group who was able to sneak behind our lines and come back unnoticed!
Unbelievable
Even if I'm already well into adulthood, no one assessed my martial prowess yet..
It's time I confront myself with a real master of arms
I've overheard the dungeon guard talking about a huge debt he accumulated by playing cards at the inn. He claims that his low salary will never be able to pay it back in time...
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] §GWILL§W become your landed vassal.\n
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] will §RNOT§W become your landed vassal.\n
[This.GetTitledFirstName] will become the independent ruler of all lands taken in the Crusade.\n
A distant relative will become the independent ruler of all lands taken in the Crusade.\n

The Clergy wishes to send a mission to convince my Pagan neighbour to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. They assure me that these Pagan lands can be brought into the arms of the church if I only agree to fund the endeavour.
I will gladly fund this mission
A waste of time and money
[This.GetTitledName] will receive your mission

A delegation of missionaries arrived today from [From.GetTitledName] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. They offered me expensive gifts and spoke at length of the merits of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith and my assured salvation if I was to convert.
I was convinced by their arguments
I accepted their gifts but gave only vague promises
I expelled them from the realm
The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a success! [From.GetTitledName] has converted to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
Deus Vult
Allah hu Akbar
The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] took the offered gifts but made only vague promises of respecting the rights of our missionaries.
Greedy heathens!
The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] refused to even accept the gifts of our missionaries, choosing instead to expel them from the realm.
Foolish heathens!
Inadequate soil preparation in [Root.GetName].
Poor seed selection hurts farming in [Root.GetName].
Lack of manure hurts farming in [Root.GetName].
Lower mean temperature hurts farming in [Root.GetName].
Arable land deserted in [Root.GetName].
Draining of marshes and fens in [Root.GetName].
Resettlement on newly claimed land in [Root.GetName].
Increased land productivity in [Root.GetName].
Pillaging

Sieges could drag on for months and even years, and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName], where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.
It can't be helped
A building goes up in flames
The besieging troops have destroyed a building in [From.Location.GetName]!
Bastards!
Someone told me I'm ruthless and I wish to change that.
Who knew being ruthless could be good?
[This.GetTitledFirstName] reacts to [Root.GetTitledFirstName] ruthless way
[From.GetTitledFirstName] seems upset with my ruthless nature.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] doesn't really understand the concept of rules and laws. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] has gained the Ruthless trait.
Do I have to abide by laws and rules? My whim sounds more interesting. I have gained the Ruthless trait.
The temptations and desires of the body no longer holds me down. I have gained the Ascetic trait.

I secretly admire a person who has led an ascetic lifestyle for many years now. I am a faithful [Root.Religion.GetName] and I have contemplated ascetism, but there has always been something that has hindered me from following that path.

For as long as have ruled here we Norse have entrusted the raising of our children to Saxon and Gaelic nursemaids. Our first words would not be Norse but Saxon or Gaelic. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
Yes, let us be one with our serfs

Around our lands more people are using this 'Anglish' language and I find this is a perfect means for a Norseman overlord to get his Saxon and Gaelic serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.
We are indeed wise
This new Anglish language does have a certain functionality. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
A most useful development

I was considering important business when I had an amazing insight. To strengthen my realm I must bring my vassals round to my way of thinking. This involves communication. If I can get them to communicate like me then I will have a much smoother running realm.
Sometimes I even surprise myself
My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Anglishness that is sweeping the realm.
Now, who ate my lutefisk?

Not unlike every other morning, a bunch of noble and peasant petitioners assembled in the great hall with various demands and requests. It is my job as a Chancellor to hear them out and decide the eventual compensations for the wrongs they might have suffered, even if not all of their claims will turn out to be justified..
During the last feast organized by my lord liege, a rather serious diplomatic incident occurred when we served roasted pork to the envoys of the local Jewish community..
During the last council I had a very intense discussion with my lord liege about the different paths the Realm should undertake, and now I fear for my job..

While travelling in the streets of [Root.Capital.GetName], a bunch of desperate peasants assembled around my carriage demanding compensations and justifications for the recent policies the realm has undertaken under my supervision. This could very well spark up a popular revolt, so I better find a good way to deal with it..

A foreign envoy just arrived at court, immediatly asking for an official meeting with the Chancellor of the Realm. As I think about whether or not I should hear him out, the guards are ready for my eventual orders on what to do with him..

Dreadful news just came to my attention: A close family member of my lord liege was seen coming out of a brothel in [Root.Capital.GetName] more than once recently, arising doubts in the smallfolk on the integrity of the House, with some going as far as claiming that even the liege himself has his head more focused on 'whores' than on the well-being of the realm..

A foreign envoy from an infidel land just arrived at court with a score of queer companions, bringing along with him many gifts from his homeland. While meeting with him, he was kind enough to hint that if I made sure the gifts were accepted, and a rich commercial deal was going to be struck as a consequence of it, I would have my fair share of wealth as well..

During the last feast organized by my lord liege, a rather serious diplomatic incident occurred when a drunken foreign envoy called my lord liege's mother a 'cunt' and suggested that what came out of her would surely be even worse than that..

A prominent philosopher recently came out with a book that could undermine the smallfolk's beliefs in our Faith and the strength of the realm with it. A course of action has to be decided, we cannot afford being idle with those dire words flowing around the mouths of the peasants..

Horrible news have reached my ears: the peasants in [Root.Capital.GetName] are increasingly talking about how the 'Church' is only lustful and sinful, and how this new schism might bring things back to a more Godly path. I have to be careful on what to do on the matter, because If those news ever reached his Holyness the Pope, he would have them all burned or hanged for such talks and I might end up joining them if I keep doing nothing about it..

A whole lot of angered peasants showed up at my doorstep with a fair looking wench who they claim is no less than a witch. Her blue eyes have something satanic about them, the leader of the mob says, and when he asked her what she was doing with all those herbs she picked up in the fields she wasn't able to give him an acceptable answer, he says, hence she must be a sorceress..

Appalling rumors: My lord liege has been increasingly spotted coming in and out of one of the most luxurious brothels of the capital, and it is now murmured that he spends more time 'whoring' than caring about the realm, and I can't even begin to describe what his Holyness' reaction will be if he hears that I justify those sinful actions under my direct watch..

Of that day and hour no-one knows: no, not even the angels of heaven, but My Father only. But as the days of Noah were, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be. For as in the days before the flood, they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark, until the flood came and took them all away.

The realm's debt towards foreign banks and crowns is higher than ever, and the representatives of those who are owed money are suggesting that if we don't pay them back immediatly, they will raise the interest of another 10%, something we truly cannot afford right now in those times of financial duress..

The latest economic policies I suggested and started to implement are turning out to be much less effective than I anticipated, and now the coffers of the realm are empty and my liege has only me to blame for it, as many and more are starting to claim..

Those are hard times for the realm: The enemy is at our doorstep, and my liege is asking me to find more gold to finance the war. I thought I already did everything I could, but after a lot of calculations I realized there are still opportunities to find wealth out there for those who aren't afraid of getting their hands a little dirty in the process..

Tiresome news: An increasing number of pious men, together with many peasants, are starting to complain about the presence of Jewish moneylanders in the realm, claiming that such practices are no less than the Devil's work and that I should make them stop at once, no matter what the repercussions might be..

An envoy of foreign merchants just arrived at court, asking for a meeting with the treasurer straightaway. As I approached them, they showered me with gifts of gold, salt and some queerer spices and jewels, promising a much richer deal if we were to reach some kind of trade agreement with them..

My liege's spending seems to be endless: there isn't a day where whole sacks of coins seem to simply disappear towards another crazy expense, making my job as a treasurer twice as hard and thrice as troubling. Something must be done about it, but what will it be?

The troops clearly lack even the slightest concept of discipline: they march in queerly formed ranks and are hardly governable and poorly disciplined, not talking about the way they make camp, or the basic lack of everyday drills of swordsmanship and bowmanship, a practice that even the weakest of our enemies surely makes sure to have up and running in his armies. Something must be done about it, better sooner than later..

As I approached our chief armorer, the situation already appeared more than dire: Even the newest swords and pikes are starting to rust, and the quality of their steel is questionable to say the least. He claims that this situation has been going on for longer than he can recall, blaming it on the lack of resources and skilled men to do the job right. Something must be done about it, and now is better than any other moment to act..

Worrying news reached my ear this morning as I presented myself to the troops for a drill: A group of soldiers under my direct command have been accused of the drunken rape and murder of a teenage peasant girl. Having been recognized by the girl's relatives and a bunch of eye witnesses there wasn't much else I could do but imprison them on the spot, and now the peasants are calling for their heads, and their comrades are threatening to revolt if the same request is granted. I have to act before it's too late to avoid any further damage to our status and reputation on one hand, and the well being and morale of my troops on the other..

A sergeant, one of the most skilled if not the best of our ranks, has been seen coming back to his tent with a young lad. While his fondness for women was always in doubt, some men are growing itchy of being under the command of someone they 'don't trust their arses with'..

The most recent inspection of our stables reported an appalling situation: Most of the horses are either lame or too old to be decently ridden, and the ones that could be magnificent beasts are poorly nourished and scarcely ever cared for. The knights are complaining, claiming that they won't be able to face any real battle if they don't have reliable mounts below them..

Treason! A small number of the newer recruits disappeared during the night, only to be caught by our scouts whoring and on their cups in a nearby village. Normally I would have their heads on a plate, but there have been so few recruits recently that we need any avaiable and willing man to our side..

The guards inform me they just caught a foreign spy trying to overhear our last council session. Although they were about to kill him on the spot, I arrived just in time to stop them. I have different plans in mind about his fate, and this little incident could turn out to be more useful than those witless soldiers might think..

My street informants have just reported me that there is a serious threat to the life of my liege going on: A few disgruntled nobles and merchants are plotting to get rid of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], as they see the current ruler as a menace to their interests and an obstacle to their rise to power. I need to act before it's too late..

Some shady people who should have never been trusted are threatening to reveal the contents of a number of letters between our liege and a 'mystery man'. It is murmured that if the contents were to be made public or were to fall into the wrong hands, the realm's safety itself and even the life of the liege himself could be at stake..

My liege's lady wife has always been known for her 'chastity', but now one of her many lovers is threatening to turn his cloak and reveal some of our dearest held secrets to the best bidder. Something should be done about this before it is too late, and most of all before it reaches my lord liege's ear.

Some 'pious men' are starting to doubt my policies as a spymaster, going as far as saying that I'm forsaking God's word for my own goals rather than serving for the best interest of the realm. For how harsh my directives might have been, the realm is safer than ever, and everything is running as smooth as it should. I have to address them before this clash turns into something potentially much more dangerous..

An enemy spy has secretly approached me, offering me to turn his cloak and tell us all he knows about our enemy's weaknesses and plans, in exchange for a certain sum of gold and a safe place to live. My liege wasn't informed yet, leaving me with complete freedom of choice on the matter..

An anonymous courier just reached me with what revealed itself to be a more than worrying missive: someone who signs himself as the 'peasant vendicator' claims that my death is near, and that my alleged ill-doings as a councillor of the realm will not go unpunished. This might not be a serious threat, but it has to be dealt with nonetheless, harshly if need be.

My liege has been clear: this is the last time my 'sloppy' policies will be tolerated, if I don't change my course of action I will become as expendable as the lamest horse in our stables, those were the exact words. I wonder whether I should apologize for something I clearly haven't done wrong, or if it wouldn't be a better idea to claim my innocence in the recent mishappenings and hope for the best..

My duty as a Knight Templar often clashes with the loyalty I owe to my liege. Many times before I put my brotherhood's interest before anything else of any importance, but this time they are openly asking me to pressure my liege into a more 'appropriate' and Godly path. It is a hard choice indeed, but it also one that has to be done sooner or later, for the best interest of everyone involved.

The Grand Master thinks this is a great time to show the world our power and the righteousness of our cause by bringing back to Europe an important saint's relic some of his informers located in a desert nearby one of our forts. This might be my chance to shine and prove myself a true Templar Knight.

Our enemies are everywhere, and the Hashashins are one of the most powerful and fearsome of them. The Grand Master believes that a pre-emptive strike might serve us best in the struggle against those infidels, claiming that a small mission of brave and pious men sent to assassinate a few selected target behind the enemy lines might do more damage than any battle will, and might turn the struggle to our side..

One of my Templar sergeants threatened me to report my increasingly nightly 'adventures' with the local wenches to the Grand Master. Knowing that he wouldn't approve any of this to say the least, I need to find a way to shut the fool's mouth up before any of this reaches the Master's ears..

Our Templar scouts managed to capture an enemy soldier and brought him back to our headquarters to be questioned and dealt with. As our best 'interrogators' worked their way with him, they couldn't get anything more than a few nonsense stumbling words, no matter how hard they pushed him. After they left the room, I was in charge of dealing with him: question him further, let him be judged by our Lord above or giving the lad a honorable soldier's death, his fate is in my hands now..

The Knight Templars formally asked me to join their ranks. This would mean a great amount of prestige and recognition, but it would also mean leaving the realm for the Holy land and putting all the most pressing matters in the hands of a regent if need be. I need to think about this carefully..
I give up most of my wealth and my ambitions and pledge my sword and loyalty to the Knight Templars!

Our current Grand Master is more idle than not, and all his tactics and strategies have revealed themselves to be nothing less than an utter failure. Since I'm one of the most prominent knights of the order, my brothers asked me to do something about it before the situation turns from tragic to hopeless, something that might very well happen sooner than we all think if we keep following his ill witted leadership..

One of our infidel informants warned me of a plot in act by the Hashashins to get rid of our current Grand Master. After I made sure he was saying the truth and hinted that if anyone else was to know this he would lose more than his freedom, it's now time to decide whether or not to act against it, and if yes in what way..
A group of bandits are tracking me and my group of templar scouts and knights, and it seems as if they are gaining on us.
Attempt to avoid them!
Its our duty to stop them..
Me and my group of templar scouts will engage the bandits.
It is not possible to outrun these bandits, and we are forced to confront them. Our better skill at arms might grant us an easy victory, but those bandits could be more treacherous than sand snakes..
They are few enough to defeat alone..
Charge!
One of my scouts just reported me that a party of Hashashins are camping not far away from us. This is a golden opportunity to blow the infidels a decisive strike..
Attempt to ambush them in the night..
The Hashashins will face our steel!
We can't risk it..
Our ambush ended in disaster... Not only did most of the Hashashins get away, but I also got severely injured during the charge that started the ambush.
The bastards got the best of me..
Success! I've left those filthy Hashashins to die in the desert...
Victory!
It seems as if we have managed to get lost here in the desert while scouting for the Grand Master. One of our humble servants seems as if he might know the right way..
I am [Root.GetTitle]! I know the best way!
Listen to the servant...

While on a scouting mission you encounter some fellow pilgrims who are returning home from Jerusalem. They have been beset by bandits who have stolen everything but their clothes and left them with no means to continue the journey.
Here. This should be enough to see you safely home.
Sorry, but I cannot afford to stop and help you. Best of luck to you.
A strange whistle is heard and the air is suddenly filled with flying daggers and arrows. Robed figures seem to rise out of the sand and the air becomes heavy with dust. It's the Hashashins!
Come then. We will sell ourselves dearly...
You make your last stand...
The battle hardens as the Hashashins strike with their ominous blades and arrows, but the final outcome is yet to be decided..
For the glory!
It can be lonely during a long war campaign, so who can blame a man for having a wench to warm his bed at night? Although it turns out one such wench has had a baby who she claims is mine!
She can have some gold for it's care
I name her a liar!
What of it? She should be honoured
I shall adopt the child into my household
A wench who I took my Lord's right upon many years ago has arrived at my gate bearing a young child who she claims is mine! I suppose he does have my eyes...
Hang her for uttering such lies!
Fighting across the field, you see an enemy soldier cut off from the others. While you can't tell who, it's clear that they must be a highborn noble.
column3: Charger!

column2: Charge!
column3: Dans le chaos des combats, vous avez été séparé de vos hommes et vous trouvez désormais en plein milieu de la bataille. Alors que vous tentez de rejoindre vos forces, vous apercevez [From.GetBestName] qui se fraye un chemin à travers les rangs ennemis avant de vous charger!

column2: You were seperated from your men in the chaos of battle, and now find yourself in the midst of war. As you scan the field and try to rejoin your forces, you see [From.GetBestName] break through the enemy ranks and charge you!
column3: Prépare toi à mourir, pourriture de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]!

column2: Prepare to die, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] scum!
column3: Je dois foutre le camp d'ici!

column2: I need to get out of here!
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName], occupe toi de [From.GetHerHim]!

column2: Get back, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]! I'll handle this!
column3: réagit

column2: reacts
column3: En vous rapprochant, vous réalisez que le soldat ennemi n'est autre que [From.GetBestName].

column2: As you get closer, you realize the enemy soldier is [From.GetBestName].
column3: Prépare toi à mourir, pourriture de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]!

column2: Prepare to die, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] scum!
column3: Je dois foutre le camp d'ici!

column2: I need to get out of here!
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName], occupe toi de [From.GetHerHim]!

column2: Get back, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]! I'll handle this!
column3: En vous rapprochant, vous réalisez que le soldat est ennemi n'est autre que [From.GetBestName]. Remarquant votre charge à travers le champs de bataille pour l'affronter, [From.GetSheHe] se retourne et fuit. Vous le(a) poursuivez, mais perdez sa trace dans le chaos des combats.

column2: As you get closer, you realize the enemy soldier is [From.GetBestName]. Seeing you charge across the field toward [From.GetHerHim], [From.GetSheHe] turns and flees. You pursue, but lose track of [From.GetHerHim] in the chaos.
column3: C'est ça, couard, retourne à [From.Capital.GetName]!

column2: That's right, coward, run back to [From.Capital.GetName]!
column3: Vous vous retournez pour faire face à [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] lorsqu'… [From.GetSheHe] stoppe sa charge et s'enfuit. Vous le(a) poursuivez, mais perdez sa trace dans le chaos des combats.

column2: You turn to face [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName]... and [From.GetSheHe] breaks [From.GetHerHis] charge and flees. You pursue, but lose track of [From.GetHerHim] in the chaos.
column3: C'est ça, couard, retourne à [From.Capital.GetName]!

column2: That's right, coward, run back to [From.Capital.GetName]!
column3: La mort de [From.GetBestName] démoralise les ennemis!

column2: [From.GetBestName]'s death demoralizes the enemy!
column3: Alors que vous venez de défaire [FromFrom.GetBestName], ses soldats commence à douter et à perdre espoir.

column2: As [FromFrom.GetBestName] falls before you, [FromFrom.GetHerHis] soldiers look on and begin to lose hope.
column3: C'est notre chance!

column2: Now's our chance!
column3: Vous détenez [From.GetBestName] prisonnier.

column2: You take [From.GetBestName] prisoner.
column3: [FromFrom.GetBestName] est étendu impuissant à vos pieds, son arme brisée et la votre à sa gorge.

column2: [FromFrom.GetBestName] lies helpless at your feet, [FromFrom.GetHerHis] weapon discarded and yours at [FromFrom.GetHerHis] throat.
column3: Venez avec moi, et marchez rapidement. Le chemin est long jusqu'à [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: Come with me, and walk fast. It's a long way to [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: Vous êtes défait. [From.GetBestName] vous garde prisonnier.

column2: You are defeated. [From.GetBestName] takes you prisoner.
column3: Je m'en souviendrai, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: I'll remember this, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

With the siege raging outside the walls, you meet with your garrison commanders. 'We already have several pots of burning oil prepared and the archers are all set as you planned,' they assure you, 'you need merely give the word, and we will see to it that most of the attacking besiegers are burned and feathered.'
Kill them all.
troops are hit.

You are about to storm the walls when the horn blows a warning. Looking up, you are horrified to see a plight of bolts and arrows and burning oil leaping toward your men from the castle walls. The oil hits the ground, and suddenly the army is consumed in fire and decimated by the bowmen.
Fall back! FALL BACK!
is caught in the flames!

ATTACK! someone had called, the only warning you ever got. The catapults atop the walls rain boiling oil and a plight of arrows. Your horse catches alight and bucks you to the ground. You try to push yourself to your feet and realize to your horror that your arm is on fire. You throw yourself to the ground and roll back and forth, desperately trying to put out the flames and avoid the incoming bolts and arrows..
Help!

You meet with your lieutenants in your tent and ask them if the surrounding trees are sound enough to build siege machines and catapults to storm the walls of [Root.Location.GetName]. 'Of course,' they say, 'We will start the preparations immediatly!'
Grand!

The battering rams and siege towers move towards the main gate and the walls at midnight, and the catapults start firing not long after. The attack is a striking victory. You can hear the screams of the slain enemies, even from this far off.
Victory!
's defenses are devastated.

You are meeting with the garrison commander when the first catapult's stone hits the walls. You watch in horror as the besiegers approach the main gate with battering rams and siege towers, slaying more men than you can count.
Argh!
I am growing so fast, It is time for me to receive a proper education! Im so excited! Life is so full of opportunities!
They will decide my future...
It is time for me to choose the right tutor for a child under my care.
[From.GetFirstName] will be educated at court.
Pay for the necessary tuitions
I want [From.GetFirstName] to be good with numbers.
Buy the necessary equipment and books.
[From.GetFirstName] will be groomed for command.
[From.GetFirstName] will have a religious education.
Buy [FromFrom.GetFirstName] a horse and a set of armor, fitting for their status.
Buy [FromFrom.GetFirstName] entrance into the nearest religious institution.
I have nor time, nor money to spend on this child.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] will not get a private tutor.
I am to be educated for life at court
I am to learn about numbers? Why?!
I will be groomed for command!
Over the past 10 years I have received an education suitable for a royal court: my manners were refined and I know much about the realms heraldry.
Over the past 10 years I have been shown the magic of numbers! I see the realm is a totally different way now...
Over the past 10 years I have been groomed for command! I am eager to prove myself by leading troops to glory!
Over the past 10 years I have been studying everything there is to know about religion! I am eager to prove myself and be a pious man someday!
These are the people I grew up with.. I feel we bonded over the years.
I grew up with [From.GetBestName], I feel I know him well
§Y$NAME$§! is now of legal age!

Worrying news reached my ear this morning as I presented myself to the troops for a drill: A group of soldiers under my direct command have been accused of the drunken rape and murder of a teenage peasant girl. Having been recognized by the girl's relatives and a bunch of eye witnesses there wasn't much else I could do but imprison them on the spot, and now the peasants are calling for their heads, and their comrades are threatening to revolt if the same request is granted. I have to act before it's too late to avoid any further damage to our status and reputation on one hand, and the well being and morale of my troops on the other..

A troubling rumor just reached my ears: a sergeant, one of the most skilled if not the best of our ranks, has been seen coming back to his tent with a young lad, who went out by himself this morning, shortly followed by the naked sergeant shouting obscenities about how he was 'robbed' at a certain brothel and about how a 'cunt' has more balls than the lad does. While his fondness for women was always in doubt, now it is hardly ignorable and some men are growing itchy of being under the command of someone they 'don't trust their arses with'. Something has to be done about it, before this turns into something more dangerous than it already is..

The most recent inspection of our stables reported an appalling situation: Most of the horses are either lame or too old to be decently ridden, and the ones that could be magnificent beasts are poorly nourished and scarcely ever cared for. The knights are complaining, claiming that they won't be able to face any more battles if they don't have reliable mounts below them..

Treason! A small number of the newer recruits disappeared during the night, only to be caught by our scouts whoring and on their cups in a nearby village. They even drunkenly admitted that theirs was no less than a desertion, and that they had no intention of ever coming back to our ranks. Normally I would have their heads on a plate, but in those dire times we may need any avaiable and willing man to our side..
One of my scouts just reported me that a party of Ghibellines are camping not far away from us. This is a golden opportunity to blow them a decisive strike..
Attempt to ambush them in the night..
The Ghibellines will face our steel!
We can't risk it..
Our ambush ended in disaster... Not only did most of the Ghibellines get away, but I also got severely injured during the charge that started the ambush.
The bastards got the best of me..
Success! I've left those filthy Ghibellines to die...
Victory! For the Pope!

A strange whistle is heard and the air is suddenly filled with flying daggers and arrows. Cloaked figures seem to rise out of nowhere and the air becomes heavy with battle. It's the Ghibellines! It's an ambush!
Come then. We will sell ourselves dearly...
You make your last stand...
The battle hardens as the Ghibellines strike with their 'misguided' blades and arrows, but the final outcome is yet to be decided..
For the Pope!
One of my scouts just reported me that a party of Guelphs are camping not far away from us. This is a golden opportunity to blow them a decisive strike..
Attempt to ambush them in the night..
The Guelphs will face our steel!
We can't risk it..
Our ambush ended in disaster... Not only did most of the Guelphs get away, but I also got severely injured during the charge that started the ambush.
The bastards got the best of me..
Success! I've left those filthy Ghibellines to die...
Victory! For the Emperor!

A strange whistle is heard and the air is suddenly filled with flying daggers and arrows. Cloaked figures seem to rise out of nowhere and the air becomes heavy with battle. It's the Guelphs! It's an ambush!
Come then. We will sell ourselves dearly...
You make your last stand...
The battle hardens as the Guelphs strike with their 'misguided' blades and arrows, but the final outcome is yet to be decided..
For the Emperor!
One of my scouts just reported me that a party of enemy soldiers are camping not far away from us. This is a golden opportunity to blow them a decisive strike..
Attempt to ambush them in the night..
The bastards will face our steel!
We can't risk it..
Our ambush ended in disaster... Not only did most of the enemy soldiers get away, but I also got severely injured during the charge that started the ambush.
The bastards got the best of me..
Success! I've left the bastards to die...
Victory!

A strange whistle is heard and the air is suddenly filled with flying daggers and arrows. Cloaked figures seem to rise out of nowhere and the air becomes heavy with battle. It's the enemy! It's an ambush!
Come then. We will sell ourselves dearly...
You make your last stand...
The battle hardens as the ambushers strike with their twisted blades and arrows, but the final outcome is yet to be decided..
For the Glory!

Ever since you have come to serve [Root.Liege.GetBestName], you have found [Root.Liege.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] increasingly irrestible. You may have sworn your fealty to your liege, but lust calls you, stronger than ever..
Our love will burn away the winter!
will be yours!

[Root.Spouse.GetFirstName]'s councillor, [From.GetFirstName], a striking young [From.GetManWoman], slips into your chambers late one night. 'My [Root.GetLordLady],' [From.GetSheHe] says, 'I have long admired you, standing in the shadow of that wretched [Root.Spouse.GetManWoman] you call your love. I beg of you, be MY love, and I will show you a world of which you have never dreamed...'
I thought you'd never ask!
What kind of [Root.GetManWoman] do you take me for?!
Oh, dear. I'm afraid you've made a terrible mistake.
would be furious if [This.GetSheHe] ever found out...

You'd thought to pay your [GetFromRelation] a surprise visit in the morning, but as you open your door, you are shocked to see [From.GetHerHim] in the arms of another [FromFrom.GetManWoman] - your trusted councillor, [FromFrom.GetFirstName]!
[Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], what's the meaning of this?!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName], you traitor, how dare you break my trust?!
I... see. So that's how it's going to be. I'll be in my chambers.
will be pleased.

You awaken to find your councillor, [FromFrom.GetFirstName], in the stocks, and your [GetFromRelation] standing guard, sitting on the steps to the keep and calmly eating an apple. 'Can you believe,' [From.GetSheHe] says, '[FromFrom.GetSheHe] actually tried to seduce me?'
Nobody could steal a [From.GetManWoman] as loyal as you, [From.GetFirstName].
falls in love with you.

You spend a night of wild passion with [From.GetFirstName]. When you finally awaken, however, the door is wide open, and [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] stands over the bed, a look of fury on [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] face.
It's not what it... okay, it's exactly what it looks like.
will spend a night in the stocks.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] takes none too kindly to your advances. You end up spending the night in the stocks while [From.GetSheHe] stands guard personally, calmly eating an apple. Come dawn, [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] finds you - and [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is none too pleased with you.
Gods have mercy...

You spend a night of wild passion together, a night only ruined when you awaken to find your [GetFromRelation] standing over the bed, furious. [From.GetSheHeCap] grabs you by your arm and pulls you to your feet. '[Root.GetFirstName],' [From.GetSheHe] shouts, 'what's the meaning of this?!'
I... I can explain...

You spend a night of wild passion together, a night only ruined when you awaken to find your [GetFromRelation] standing over the bed, furious. [From.GetSheHeCap] heaves your lover from the bed. 'Traitor! How DARE you break my trust?'
This could turn ugly, fast.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] ignores you and goes straight for your lover, hauling [From.Spouse.GetHerHim] from the bed. '[From.Spouse.GetFirstName], what's the meaning of this?!'
Now would probably be a good time to leave...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] heaves you from the bed. '[Root.GetFirstName], you traitor!' [From.GetSheHe] shouts, 'How dare you break my trust?'
Vows are a thing for men. What should a beast care?

You spend a night of wild passion together, a night only ruined when you awaken to find your [GetFromRelation] standing over the bed, furious. [From.GetSheHeCap] glares at you both, [From.GetHerHis] rage slowly building to a peak - and then subsiding. 'I... I see,' [From.GetSheHe] says, 'so that's how it's going to be, then. I hope you two will be very happy together.'
Please, wait, I can explain...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] glares at you both, [From.GetHerHis] rage slowly building to a peak - and then subsiding. 'I... I see,' [From.GetSheHe] says, 'so that's how it's going to be, then. I hope you two will be very happy together.'
You'll keep love in chains no more.

You call for the guards and have the bastard locked in the stocks, taking a seat beside [From.GetHerHim] and biting into an apple. Come the morning, your [GetFromRelation] walks into the courtyard to find the two of you. 'Can you believe,' you say, '[From.GetSheHe] actually tried to seduce me?' Your [GetFromRelation] grins. 'Nobody could steal a [Root.GetManWoman] as faithful as you, [Root.GetFirstName].'
Perhaps I'll be finding love tonight after all...
There are rumors that a skilled Norman swordsman is passing through a nearby town.
A Norman who claims to be a master bladesman approached me and offered his services in teaching my ward.
Away with you! You shall not poison my ward's mind with your gibberish!
I will gladly pay your price, but I hope you are as good as you claim!
I am so disappointed, my guardian has chosen not to hire the foreigner to teach me
I am so happy , my guardian chose to hire a Norman swordmaster to serve me as a tutor!
There is a rumor that a Jewish banker is passing through a nearby town.
A renowned Jewish banker has offered to tutor my ward… For a price, of course.
There is a rumor that a famous Muslim envoy is passing through a nearby town.
A well dressed and apparently very well considered Muslim envoy has approached me, offering to tutor my ward… For a price, of course.
Your daily training with your Norman master of arms might actually pay off...

I've been an active Templar for quite a long time now, and the more I linger here in the Holy land the more the realm needs me. I wonder whether I should spend the few years that I have left in the warm halls of my castle..

After a few days another ship passes nearby, and to everyone's relief their lookout spots your stranded party. Though weakened by the lack of food and water, everyone survives thanks to your decision to share supplies evenly.
Now we can all get safely home!

After a few days another ship passes nearby, and to everyone's relief their lookout spots your stranded party. For some of the survivors it is too late, but at least you are in good health, as, befitting of your great station, the lion's share of water and food has gone to you.
Onwards! Home!

You take passage on a ship on your way back from the Holy land, but the crew is soon exposed as less than honourable. The captain is overheard discussing how he and his men will sell the passengers he is carrying, including you, into slavery at the next port!
That will not come to pass. To arms!
We will sneak off the ship just before it docks...

Together with the other passengers, you turn against the crew and a fierce struggle ensues. The battle ends when you run your blade through the treacherous captain's gut and the rest of the crew surrenders. The ship is under your command!
Set sail for the homeland!

As the ship approaches the next port, you quietly slip away into the water, and swim ashore some distance away from the docks as a drenched but free man. The other people on the ship are not so fortunate..
At least now we can get safely home
The realm calls me! I'll book a passage on the first ship.
As you travel over the sea, your ship spots the sails of a well-known Muslim corsair. We have a faster ship, and the chance to eliminate this threat to pilgrims and honest seamen forever!
Dreadful news: the army camp has been struck by famine and disease! Many soldiers are dying and many others are far too weak to keep on fighting, and I feel like I was burning inside myself..
Bad news: most of our camp provisions have gone bad, leaving many soldiers dead or dying. I'm still wondering whether I ate some of that ominous stuff myself..
[From.GetSheHeCap] is too ruthless
[From.GetTitledFirstName] thinks I am a bad person for being so ruthless!
Ad Abolendam

Ad Abolendam was a decretal and papal bull, written at Verona in November 1184. It was developed after the Council of Verona settled some jurisdictional differences between the Papacy and the Holy Roman Emperor. The document prescribes measures to uproot heresy and sparked the efforts which culminated in the Albigensian Crusade and the Inquisitions. Its chief aim was the complete abolition of Christian heresy.
This will be good for the religious peace of the realm.
The old man is just crazy.
Ad Extirpanda

Ad Extirpanda (named for its Latin incipit) was a papal bull which explicitly authorized (and defined the appropriate circumstances for) the use of torture by the Inquisition for eliciting confessions from heretics.
This will be good for the religious peace of the realm.
The old man is just crazy.

My child doesn't share my own religious beliefs: This could mean future instability, together with mockery and a growing sense of injustice I'm starting to feel towards this divergence between my offspring and I..
The kid will follow the one true faith!
Children are too young for this religious gibberish
My lord husband decided that our child has to follow his own religious faith, and asked me to convert along with him to this 'higher' doctrine.
There is sense in this faith my husband speaks of
WHAT?!?
My wife converted along with our child to the true faith!
God bless!
My wife opposed our child's conversion to the true faith!
What a bitch!

You just heard about the chance to demand a trial by fire in order to prove that you've been unjustly imprisoned. If your liege agrees and you survive the ordeal unharmed you will have to be released….that is IF you survive.
God will prove my innocence!
I'd rather rot here than put my fate in the hands of God..
My prisoner, [From.GetBestName], is claiming to be innocent and that [From.GetHerHis] imprisonment is unjust. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] demands a trial by fire to prove this.
Why not? I have no doubt God will support my righteous cause.
God may rule in heaven but here on earth 'I' am the law!
[From.GetBestName] has decided to grant your request for a trial by fire. The preparations should begin shortly.
Praise to start practicing with my candle, I suppose.
The dastardly [From.GetBestName] seems to know that God is on my side and thus has denied my request for a trial by fire.
It might be time to consider paying that ransom…
[From.GetBestName] has decided to let one of [From.GetHerHis] prisoners undergo a trial by fire and is asking you to serve as judge to ensure proper proceedings.
Very well, I always enjoy a good barbecue.

[From.GetBestName] has been chosen to act as judge in the upcoming trial by fire. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] will ensure that the trial will be fair and that its outcome will only be determined by God.
So be it!

While I have absolute faith in God, I don't trust my prisoner. Who knows, I don't really trust the bastard's honesty.. Maybe I'd better tell my guards to soak the robes that will be worn for the trial in oil?
Sometimes you just have to 'help' justice along... a little.
That won't be necessary. God will ensure that justice prevails!
I have a feeling that my depraved imprisoner will manipulate my trial by fire to make sure that I perish. There has to be something I can do…
If I soak my robes in water, it might protect me from the flames.
God is on my side. What more protection do I need?
It would seem that [From.GetBestName] is making preparations to manipulate the upcoming trial by fire in [From.GetHerHis] favour. As the judge, I should probably do something…
I shall ensure a fair trial!
If you're not cheating, you're not trying hard enough.
The day of my trial by fire has arrived. As I stare into the flames I feel a hint of fear but there is no turning back now.
These robes aren't flammable, are they?

The day of the trial by fire has arrived. After hours of preparing the courtyard, stacking wood and straw and lighting it all up now all eyes are on the prisoner as he makes his first steps towards the blazing flames.
It's time to burn, you scum!

The day of the trial by fire has arrived. As you watch the guards prepare the courtyard and the prisoner you sit back, knowing that you have done your part in ensuring a fair trial and a great spectacle.
Let the show begin!

It would appear that your fancy robes, while they certainly were most fashionable, also were very flammable. Unfortunately for you, fashion is not taken into consideration during a trial by fire and so you burned to death.
At least I'm a very well-dressed corpse.
While you knew all along that you were right in imprisoning [From.GetBestName], now everybody else knows it, too. God testified on your behalf by burning [From.GetObjectPronoun] to a crisp.
Let's roast some meat while the pyre is still hot.
It seems that [From.GetBestName] was guilty of something, after all', you conclude after seeing [From.GetHerHis] charred remains among the ashes.
Let's do this again, sometime.
As you emerge from the flames you stop and check every part of your body. To your own surprise you realize that while some of your clothes are more or less gone, you yourself are actually unharmed.
It's a miracle…erm…I mean, I knew it all along!

You can't believe your eyes as a silhouette steps out of the flames. You immediately send your guards to investigate and to your horror they report that [From.GetBestName] has not been touched by the fire at all.
This cannot be!

After a while a silhouette emerges from the fiery inferno and as you approach it you recognize [From.GetBestName]. [From.GetHerHis] robes are looking more like a beggar's rags now but [From.GetHerHis] body shows no injury whatsoever.
Let [From.GetObjectPonoun] go at once. Deus vult!
As you emerge from the flames you stop and check every part of your body. Suddenly you feel a sharp pain and you notice that while you survived, you're also horribly burnt.
*faint*

You can't believe your eyes as a silhouette steps out of the flames. You immediately send your guards to investigate and they report that [From.GetBestName] has survived but is also almost unrecognisably burnt.
What now?
After a while a silhouette emerges from the fiery inferno and as you approach it you recognize [From.GetBestName]. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] is alive but [From.GetHerHis] flesh is horribly burnt.
[From.GetSubjectPronounCap] is alive, so [From.GetSubjectPronoun] should go free!
[From.GetSubjectPronounCap] might have survived but clearly not through divine intervention. Back to prison!

Since the result of your trial by fire was inconclusive, it's final interpretation was up to the judge. [From.GetBestName] decided in favour of releasing you but it's a hollow victory as your burn scars will be seen as evidence by your enemies that you were guilty after all.
Next time I'll just pay the ransom!
Since the result of the trial by fire was inconclusive, its final interpretation was up to the judge. [From.GetBestName] decided to release your prisoner!
Next time we'll use twice as much wood!

Since the result of your trial by fire was inconclusive, it's final interpretation was up to the judge. [From.GetBestName] decided in to keep you imprisoned which would outrage you, if you weren't still unconscious from your injuries.
At least I'm still alive, right?
Since the result of the trial by fire was inconclusive, its final interpretation was up to the judge. [From.GetBestName] followed your advice and decided against releasing your prisoner.
At least we got rid of all my old furniture.
I will go to Lady [This.GetFirstName]'s chamber
For the son dishonoureth the father, the daughter riseth up against her mother, the daughter in law against her mother in law: A man's enemies are the men of his own house.
It's still family I guess
There has been a marriage in my court.
I wish them well
I get married and my family grows
I love my wife. My in-laws, not so much.
I love my husband. My in-laws, not so much.
I get married and my family grows
I love my wife. My in-laws, not so much.
I love my husband. My in-laws, not so much.
I have completed my education.
column4: Ich habe meine Ausbildung beendet.

column2: I became an Amateurish Plotter

column4: Ich wurde eine Graue Eminenz

column4: Ich wurde ein Geiziger Kaufmann

column2: I became a Fortune Builder
column4: Ich wurde ein Karrierekaufmann

column2: I became Midas Touched
column4: Ich wurde ein Goldvermehrer

column2: I became a Skilled Tactician
column4: Ich wurde ein Fähiger Taktiker

column2: I became a Brilliant Strategist
column4: Ich wurde ein Brillanter Stratege

column4: Ich wurde ein Wanderpriester

column2: I became a Dutiful Cleric
column4: Ich wurde ein Pflichtbewusster Geistlicher

column4: Ich wurde ein Gelehrter Theologe

column2: I have shown great heroism in this glorious victory! My liege has therefore decided to knight me!
I have shown great courage in this glorious victory! My liege has therefore ordered a knight to take me as his squire!

Many knights have departed to the search of the Holy Grail, but nobody has returned with the legendary goblet that caught the blood of Christ.\nBut recurrent braggarts tell that it is guarded somewhere in Palestine
They are only foolish popular superstitions
It has been searched for enough in the past!
And if were really my destiny to find it?

Many knights have departed to the search of the Holy Grail, but nobody has returned with the legendary goblet that held the blood of Christ. A reliable source just informed me that many and recurrent braggarts tell that it is guarded somewhere in Thrace..

Many knights have departed to the search of the Holy Grail, but nobody has returned with the legendary goblet that held the blood of Christ. A reliable source just informed me that many and recurrent braggarts tell that it is guarded somewhere in the Champagne area..

Many knights have departed to the search of the Holy Grail, but nobody has returned with the legendary goblet that held the blood of Christ. A reliable source just informed me that many and recurrent braggarts tell that it is guarded somewhere along the shores of the Po river..

Many knights have departed to the search of the Holy Grail, but nobody has returned with the legendary goblet that held the blood of Christ. A reliable source just informed me that many and recurrent braggarts tell that it is guarded somewhere in the eastern Spanish Sierra..
To recover the precious relic it will be necessary to finance a journey to the area where it is said to be hidden, and let the faith in our Lord above guide us!
I'm ready for this perilous task!
It's only a waste of time..
Last night I dreamt of a knight suspended in the void who grabbed a mystical gilded cup.. What can be the meaning of all of this?
Nothing, I just drank a bit too much
Interrogate the peasants in the surrounding area
It was the Grail! It is here! I need to find it!
The people of the area seem to be knowing a precious secret, but are very hesitant to reveal it..
A bag of gold might ease their tongues
With some money and a bit of luck the Grail will be ours
Let's leave it be, it is not worth it!
I am certain that the Grail is kept guarded somewhere around the area, and I will slay all those useless peasants if its location isn't revealed to me!
There will be blood
With a few drops of blood and a bit of luck..
Tiresome news: The goblet seems nowhere to be found, and after months of researches my men and I are starting to doubt it even ever existed..
It is time to think about more earthly matters
Here it is finally! I have found the Holy Grail!
Gloria!

Pilgrims and merchants arriving from Byzantium tell with amazement tales of the 'Mandylion', the shroud that is supposed to have wrapped the body of Christ, taken from the cross. They say that on it mysteriously remains an engraved mystical image..
The stress of the journey causes strong hallucinations!
I know it well, but I am occupied with other matters
I will depart immediately to see it with my eyes!

Pilgrims and merchants arriving from Lirey tell with amazement of the 'Shroud', a linen that is supposed to have wrapped the body of Christ, taken from the cross. They say that on it there has mysteriously remained engraved a mystical image
Seeing the Man on the shroud was an intensely emotional encounter..
It is indeed a divine revelation!
Interesting! Who is the artist that painted it?

The Templars have been searching a long time for the 'Mandylion', the shroud that is supposed to have wrapped the body of Christ, taken from the cross. All of traces of it were lost after it was stolen from Byzantium. Today, during a meeting, they have revealed their assumptions and the plans for its recovery..
They are fanatics, I will not join their cause!
It is probably still guarded in Byzantium…
I am inspired to look for it in Athens…
I've heard it's owned by some French noble…
Together with the Knights Templars you have gone to the secret place where you believe the 'Mandylion' to be hidden. The trip is long and full of traps, and in the end...
Nothing, it was all for naught!
Together with the Knights Templars you have gone to the secret place where you believe the 'Mandylion' to be hidden. The trip is long and full of traps, and in the end...
Ambush!!
Together with the Knights Templars you have gone to the secret place where you believe the 'Mandylion' to be hidden. The trip is long and full of traps, and in the end...
It's the Right place!
After gathering some information you learn that a rich and influential Jewish family guards the precious relic in their castle..
I have Templars with me! I will demolish the castle!
We will try to steal it, catching them by surprise
I will personally go to bargain over its purchase
I ask permission to see it, and I will return home
Attacking a castle is not as easy as picking flowers, but it is a grave enterprise, dangerous and with an uncertain result!
I have come and am ready to spill my blood!
A different technique could perhaps be found
The assault in the castle is violent and bloody. Tall flames arise from the Great Hall that holds the relic!
Only with great fortune it will be found intact!
To succesfully infiltrate the castle we'll need dexterity and agility, and we should do it unarmed. Nobody is suspicious yet, but the watch is vigilant!
One: climb the walls. If it goes wrong, return home!
Perhaps it is best to reconsider this
The watch has not noticed anything! Now we must infiltrate the tower from the courtyard
Two: raise the gate. If it goes wrong, return home!
The hinges are rusted, we'd better think of something else..
They must be deep sleepers not to have noticed all that creaking! Soon, we'll be at the Great Hall!
Three: steal the shroud. If it goes wrong, return home!
Detach it from the wall and refold it? There's no time!
Damn! People are arriving from the corridors! Hand me the bag with the 'Mandylion', I know what to do!
Down the window!
You are received with respect, but you find yourself in the presence of wealthy and experienced merchants. It will be difficult to make an agreement on a reasonable price..
I offer 1000 pieces of gold. Are they enough?
Why spend money? Let's return and think it over!
The gold has been cashed by the treasurer quickly, but it will be sufficient to complete the purchase?
More gold? I hope this isn't a fake..
No, we risk bankruptcy! Let's change tactics!
The 'Mandylion' research has failed! Let's go home!
Argh!
The 'Mandylion' has finally been brought back to the light! A as reward for the abnegation that you have shown, the Grand Master of the Templars entrusts it in custody to you and your descendants.
As history demands!
After we managed to reacquire the Mandylion, the only thing that's left is to build a proper temple in its honour, so that everyone can admire such miracle!
As history demands!
After we managed to reacquire the Grail, the only thing that's left is to build a proper temple in its honour, so that everyone can admire such miracle!
As history demands!
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offered to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.
column3: [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offered to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.
column4: [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offered to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.
column6: [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offered to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.

column2: I will pay for my freedom, if I can afford it.
column3: I will pay for my freedom.
column4: I will pay for my freedom.
column6: I will pay for my freedom.

column2: I will not pay.
column3: I will not pay.
column4: I will not pay.
column6: I will not pay.

column2: You have received a ransom request for one of your courtiers. It is a good deal...
I will pay to get them back.
I will not pay to get them back.
The ransom has been denied!
Well, let them rot...
How dare he!
column3: Comment osez vous!
column4: Wie kann er nur!
column5: How dare he!
column6: How dare he!

column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat den Vasall-Vertrag gebrochen. Ich bin jetzt unabhängig.

column6: My liege has broken the vassal contract. I am now independent.

column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat meinen Ehrentitel widerrufen.

column2: Outrageous!
column3: C'est outrageant!
column4: Unerhört!
column5: Outrageous!
column6: Outrageous!

column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat meinen Ehrentitel widerrufen.
column5: My liege has revoked my Honorary Title.
