column6: About time

column2: As I prepare for the blot, there was a knock on the door. As I opened, an old seidmann, ragged of clothing and weathered by the wind stood there. He asks 'Could a wanderer stay until you've had your blot?'
Of course, and feel free to join the blot!
You can stay, but the blot is for me and mine.
No! Your kind has no place in my home!
A fellow seidmann? Welcome! Let us talk!
First I need to consider how much food and drink I will purchase for the Blot, to honour the Gods.
The Gods deserve the best! The cost is irrelevant! Praise Odin!
No one shall call us unfaithful. Spend, but not excessively.
We are on a budget here. Spend just as much as we need.
One of my hirdmenn caught some christians as they were plotting to disrupt the Blot!
Imprison them!
It is this kind of think our ancestors made the 'Blood-Eagle' for...
Let them go.
After a long night of drinking, feasting and honouring the Gods, the Blot is over.
Now to prepare for the next Blot…
Disaster! Despite our best attempts, we do not have enough meat for the Blot!
Let us wait for some tradesmen…
I will catch us some meat! Into the woods boys!
The peasants will provide!
We do have plenty of 'meat' just walking around…
As we prepare for the Blot, some of your more… old-fashioned hirdmenn have suggested we send one of Kvitekrists praying men to Valhalla at the Blot…
What an excellent proposition! Purchase a Monk Thrall at once!
What a great suggestion! Let us kidnap a monk at once!
Why settle for one? Ready my longboat! We'll burn the nearest monastery!
Human sacrifice? Really?
Who shall we invite to the Blot?
My loyal vassals!
My loyal hirdmen!
Both!
Send invitation
Hail Odin! I am holding a Blot in honour of the gods, and you are invited to share in this praising of the Aesir and Vanir!
Hail Odin!
I got other plans…
My liege, I cannot attend your blot due to urgent matters elsewhere…
Rejected!
The food and mead is prepared and the guests have arrived… the Blot can begin!
Hail Odin! Hail Tor! Hail Loke! Hail Frøya! Hail…
You have finally arrived… the Blot begins!
Hail Odin! Hail Tor! Hail Loke! Hail Frøya! Hail…
After a long night of drinking, feasting and honouring the Gods, the Blot is over.
My head…
Send off the guests
Send invitations
Send our refusal
Welcome the guests to the Blot
Some poorer farmers have come, asking if they can join us at the Blot.
Let them stay and feast with us at the Blot!
They can stay, but they better work for it!
No, throw them out!
A wandering Skald has come, requesting a chance to tell tales of old and the Gods at your blot for a modest fee!
Let him stay!
Skalds are shifty… Let him stay, but keep him under a close watch.
No!
As the Blot draws near, it is time to think about which god to honour the most...
Odin, God of Wisdom and Kings!
Tor, God of Thunder and the Commoners!
Loke, God of Fire and Mischief!
Freya, Goddess of Fertility and Beauty!
Tyr, God of War!
The Court Volva has predicted that the Blot will be a failure unless we build a statue dedicated to Odin!
Build it at once!
Predicted? Why am I employing that woman?
Odin? I prefer Tor!
Odin? I prefer Loke!
Disaster! We do not have enough room for all the guests at the Kungsgård!
Build some temporary shelter
Force some of the farmers to lend us room.
Throw out some thralls and let some guests sleep in their… homes.
Let us move the Blot to a larger Kungsgård.
A travelling merchant arrived, claiming to be selling mead from Valhalla itself!
Buy some!
Buy all of it!
Riiight. Valhallan mead. Hird! Arrest him for fraud!
We won't have any
A small group of Berserkers passed by, hearing of your Blot, and asked to be able to join.
Of course. The more the merrier!
They can stay, but the blot is for me and mine.
Berserkers? Of course they can come! And I'll challenge their leader to a fistfight!
No. Berserkers are nothing but trouble.
The peasant small-holders in [Root.GetName] demand that I relinquish some of my control!
Hmm.. They may have a point..
Never!
The peasant small-holders in [Root.GetName] are resisting what they claim to be draconian taxes!
Filthy peasants!
The peasant small-holders in [Root.GetName] are now back to quiet!
It was about time!
One of our bailiffs was attacked by the peasants while traveling in [Root.GetName]!
Punish the peasants!
Perhaps a small tax-return is in order…
I never liked the guy
The peasant small-holders in [Root.GetName] have returned to their farms, for now.
Some peace at last!
You have lost the respect of the people, and a challenger has risen against you!
His head will decorate my hall!
Your liege cares not that you were beat up by farmers!
That ergi!
A challenger has risen against you, gaining support because of your attempts to centralize power around the crown!
Remove his support by decentralizing!
Remove his support BY REMOVING HIS HEAD! TO WAR!
My chief is weak! I bet I could take him in a fight!
I'll challenge him!
Nah. On second thought, I got better things to do…
Send out the challenge!
One of your subjects challenge you to a duel!
I accept!
I back down!
Convince him otherwise
Agree to the duel
Back out of the duel
Convince him this is unnecessary
Your liege have agreed to the duel.
Get ready to rumble!
Your liege have denied to duel.
What a sniveling coward…
Your liege made a very persuasive case on why this whole challenge was just unnecessary…
Huh.
You wounded your liege!
You maimed your liege!
You killed your liege!
Your liege won!
You won!
You lost the duel, and was wounded in the process!
Ouch
You lost the duel, and was maimed in the process!
Ouch
You lost the duel, and was killed in the process!
Farewell cruel world!
You won the duel!
Victory is mine!
You lost the duel!
Next time I'll get him!
Your pagan husband has gone too far! He has enslaved some poor monks.
Tell him he'll sleep on the couch if they are not released!
Monks, schmonks.
Tell him to release the monks!
Your christian wife (only the Gods know why you married her) says that if you do not immediately release all monks in your captivity, you'll have to sleep on the floor!
The floor? Looks like the monks are free…
I need those monks for… Reasons.
Your wife has proved utterly incompetent in running the household!
Oh well, nothing I can do…
I'll get a new wife!
Beat some sense into her!
I guess I'll take over her duties…
Your wife gets the message
You beat your wife
Your spouse has divorced you!
Why dear? Why?!
Your husband has hit you!
Time for a divorce!
But… I love him!
Seeing you run the household personally have caused people to talk behind your back…
Damn!
Time to teach them why I am the chief!
The people of [Root.GetName] have returned to their old ways!
Hail the Gods!
You were woken up in the early hours in the morning with disastrous news! A thrall had escaped!
Oh well…
I will have his head on a spike!
Cover it up.
There's been talk among the people that you are too cowardly to go on viking…
I don't care about talk!
They think me a coward? Time to pillage!
After I returned from the viking, I have heard talk that my dear spouse have been having a lot of fun with my courtiers, servants, hird, thralls, random passers by…
I'm sure there is nothing to the rumours.
What? But… only I can do that!
Time for a divorce!
So?
It all became clear this morning. I am the son Odin, the Allfather and creator of man!
Hail me!
A Godi dared to challenge me today, claiming that no son of Odin should have two eyes! Which I have!
NOT ANYMORE!
He… might have a point…
Your husband believes that he is the son of Odin, the Allfather!
Perhaps… perhaps he is?
This is what Christians call blasphemy!
Your wife said she thinks you are the son of Odin, the Allfather!
Of course!
Your wife came to you and said that you should stop thinking you are the son of Odin!
Begone wife!
Perhaps… Perhaps she is right?
As you walked through the farm, you didn't find Hugin and Munin any where! I was certain dad, Odin the Allfather, gave me some!
I'll need new Ravens!
No-one has seen them… perhaps I am not the son of Odin?
At the Ting, a large group of farmers and hirdmenn challenged my divinity! They asked me why they should think I am the son of Odin!
Are my deeds not evidence!?
Is my piety not known?!
Could anyone but the son of the Allfather have such deep coffers?!
They should.. Because…
I woke up, thinking of how to divine the future with the Seid knowledge… And realized I don't know how to Seid…
I just need some time! And help! Call for a Volva! I'll pay handsomely!
Why don't I know? Am I really of Odin's blood?
Your two ravens, your one eye, your knowledge of Seid all speak for your legitimacy as the son of the Allfather. Luckily, your spouse, the godis and the people also speak for your legitimacy.
Everybody Hail Me!
Tell him you believe him
It all became clear this morning. I am the son of Loke, the God who will one day betray the Æsir!
Hail me!
One if by hirdmenn, a large fellow, challenged me to an eating competition to prove I am the son of Loke!
Hah! I will easily beat him! My father nearly beat fire once!
I'm… not sure I can beat him…
Your husband believes that he is the son of Loke!
Perhaps… perhaps he is?
This is what Christians call blasphemy!
Your wife said she thinks you are the son of Loke! In a good way!
I might not throw her to the wolves!
Your wife came to you and said that you should stop thinking you are the son of Loke!
I understand her not trusting the son of Loke, but she must still leave!
Perhaps… Perhaps she is right?
A Godi, wise in the ways of the Gods, claim you aren't Loke! He says you must prove yourself by tricking him into giving up a pouch of silver!
This should be easy!
I'm not entirely sure about this…
At the Ting, a large group of farmers and hirdmenn challenged my divinity! They asked me why they should think I am the son of Loke!
Is my cunning not evidence?
You want evidence? I will give you evidence…
Could anyone but Loke have such deep coffers?
They should.. Because…
As everyone knows my father is versed in shapeshifting and seid. Then why don't I know how to seid?
I just need some time! And help! Call for a Volva! I'll pay handsomely!
I… Don't know…
Your deceitful nature, your silver tongue, your nefarious schemes… you are the son of Loke, at least in your own eyes and in the eyes of the people.
Everybody Hail Me!
It all became clear this morning. I am daughter of Freya, Goddess of Love, Beauty and Battle!
Hail me!
One of my hirdmenn laughed when I said I was the daughter of Freya! He said I wasn't pretty enough!
I will show him! I am the daughter of Freya! Goddess of Beauty! I WILL BECOME BEAUTIFUL!
Not pretty? But… I'm Freya's blood… Aren't I?
Your wife believes she is the daughter of Freya!
Perhaps… perhaps she is?
This is what Christians call blasphemy!
Your husband said he thinks you are the daughter of Freya!
I might limit myself to his bed… for a few days…
Your husband came to you and said that you should stop thinking you are Freya's daughter!
What? That… that… I don't want to see him again!
Perhaps… Perhaps he is right?
An old Godi, ugly and short, said he and his brethren would not believe your are Freya's daughter until you sleep with him, the most loathsome of them all.
Can you wear a bag? No? Oh well… Let's get this over with…
What? No… I won't…
At the Ting, a large group of farmers and hirdmenn challenged my divinity! They asked me why they should think I am Freya's daughter!
Is my looks not evidence?
Is my silver tongue not evidence?
Could anyone but Freya's daughter have such deep coffers?
They should.. Because…
My mother taught Odin himself the art of Seid! Then… how come I can't remember how to do it?
It'll come back… I'll hire a Volva to make it come back faster!
I… Don't know…

You are Freya's daughter. Your looks, liberal views on matrimony, your looks, your knowledge of seid, your silver tongue and your looks have convinced the people, the godis and the chiefs that you are Freya, Goddess of Beauty!
Everybody Hail Me!
A young warrior with nothing to lose and everything to gain stopped me on the path, challenging me to a duel then and there… my entire Hird is watching…
Duel!
Back down and pay him.
I'm a coward, a laughing stock, a disgrace to my family… Perhaps I should try to be braver?
Yes! I must be brave!
No, better to be an honest coward than a lying warrior.
As a Seidmann I occasionally do get into trouble. This is one of those times, as I find myself surrounded by five burly, drunk, men throwing slurs at me while brandishing weapons…
They want to mess with a Seidmann? TO VALHALLA!
Flee!
Your children are also recognised as having the blood of Loke!
Hurrah!
Your children are also recognised as having the blood of Odin!
Hurrah!
Your children are also recognised as having the blood of Freya!
Hurrah!
Seeing as how you don't believe the old gods exist, why do you claim you are of their blood..?
I no longer claim to be of divine blood!
You are right! Hail Odin! Hail Tor! Hail Freya! Hail Loke! Hail…
You can now centralize!
About time!
Your acts have no gone unnoticed by the powerful in the realm, and the Tings are about to declare you a Niding!
I suppose there is nothing I can do…
My silver will sway the tings my way!
My friends will sway the tings my way!
My hirdsmenn will cut down whoever speaks against me!
There is a possibility that your niding situation might be resolved in the next Ting…
I sure hope so!
Let us make it a guarantee!
Due to having been declared a Niding, it is not dishonourable, nor even punishable, to slay you and take your wealth… A band of warriors have attacked you and your Hird!
To valhalla!
Your husband is really not the man you had hoped for to marry…
Time for a divorce!
We can make it work.
I fear that my death is approaching quick… Will I see the glory of Valhalla, or am I doomed to crippling boredom in Hel?
Challenge the strongest man in the realm to a fight!
Time to raid!
I'm sure I got a bit of life in me left…
The Norse care not for who you choose to sleep with, as long as you're not weak about it.
Pffh, I'm man enough to sleep with other men!
You… don't want to have sex? Ever? Odd…
It is my choice!
You might have a point…
You enjoy life, and no-one faults you for that!
More mead! More women!
An affair or two won't get the Volva or Seidmenn angry at you.
Thank Odin
You don't want to..?
No, not with you.
A whole pig and two chickens in one meal… You're the talk of the town!
And tomorrow it will be two!
Some want more. You are not some.
I'm content
When you stood in front of the wolf, unflinchingly staring it down, all knew you were brave.
I don't even know what 'fear' means!
No norseman can respect someone who runs away from danger.
I don't flee I make a tactical retreat!
Being able to lift up two thralls at once truly makes your fellow warriors respect you.
[Root.GetFirstName] smash!
As the scrawny monk thrall smashed your fist onto the table while the entire court watched, you knew you wouldn't be able to live it down…
He is stronger than he looks!
You are no longer considered as this.
Ok
The ignorant farmers think that your Seid has hurt their crops! Fools!
Fools!
A wanderer have told you that your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has commited Seid that has damaged the crops and killed the livestock!
It is just superstitious farmers…
Throw  [From.GetHerHim] into the dungeon!
The weather, the animals, the rumours… All can be omens, and you know this is a good one!
Hill Freya!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has given me an omen to…
Conquer! I must prepare for the future battles at once!
Prosper! I should make an investment!
Rule! Time to get the Chiefs and Jarls under my banner!
Scheme! Now is the time to prepare for plots!
The weather, the animals, the rumours… All can be omens, and you know this is a bad one!
Hill Freya!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has foreseen bad portents..
Oh no!
Right, 'portents'…
Give an alternative reading of those portents.
Volva scares locals!
Volva sees a good omen!
Volva sees a bad omen!
Volva cures local child's disease!
It took weeks of nurturing and the best of my herbal knowledge, but the seemingly doomed child walked again today!
Hill Freya!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has cured a local child of a seemingly lethal and cruel disease!
Good.
Really?
You are not a Volva!
I am a Seidmann
You are not a Seidmann!
I am a Volva
The disease simply won't leave… I'm weak… Perhaps I should seek out a volva or seidmann?
Yes!
No!
My spouse knows Seid!
The disease simply won't leave… I'm weak… It seems like it is time to use my skills.
Now to seek out some herbs…
My… condition… have plagued me and my family for so long, perhaps the Volva can cure it?
It is worth a try
No
There was a knock on the door, and a volva stood outside asking if I wanted to know my future in return for some shelter and food…
The future? Of course!
Tell her 'no', but give her food and shelter for the night anyway
Slam the door in her face!

There's an old Seidmann living in the woods, a strange fellow occasionally giving sage advice. Some locals have come to you to have him removed, as he is reputed to be involved in human sacrifice, cannibalism and wearing cats on his head.
Gather the hird! I'll deal with this seidmann!
Seid can't do anything against me! I'll deal with him personally!
Well, we'll just have to live with this seidmann…
I'll speak with him, Seidmann to Seidmann.
A seidmann approached me today, having heard of my knowledge and piety, and offered me to learn the ways of Seid…
The secrets of Seid will be mine!
What? Seid is for women and 'men'!
A volva approached me today, having heard of my knowledge and piety, and offered me to learn the ways of Seid…
The secrets of Seid will be mine!
No, I got better things to do than dance naked in the forest!
One of your vassals have proven to be quite ambitious… perhaps too ambitious…
With Seid, the vassal will be dealt with!
A bit of ambition isn't bad
Seid is discovered!
Seid is successful!
Seid is lethally successful!
[From.GetFirstName] tried to commit seid on me!
That niding!
Something… something isn't right… is this seid?
Odin, protect me!
Struck dead with Seid!
I still get to Valhalla, right? Right?
Your rival has been a thorn in your side for long… Perhaps it is time to deal with this situation?
Time to get some herbs…
Seid isn't for personal vendettas!
Reveal the coward!
Disaster! Your intended victim survived the Seid, and even worse, know it was you!
Damn!
The seid was successful! Your victim languishes from his last meal!
Hill Freya!
The seid was successful! Your victim lies dead, struck down by poison!
Hill Freya!
No follower of the Lord should do sorcery!
I recant my wicked ways!
There was a knock on the door to the kungsgård you currently reside in. Outside stand a volva, asking for a place in your household…
Allow her to stay
Give her shelter and food for a few days
Refuse her
My wounds have not healed… Perhaps I should see a Volva?
Yes!
No!
My spouse knows Seid and looks at my wounds anyway...
Surprised by knights!
As you and your men plunder, you are beset by a group of heavily armed knights!
To Valhalla!
He who runs away, lives to plunder another day!
As the months pass, the men begin to get restless for home and wives…
Let us get home!
Just one… more… village…
A small fishing village has been spotted!
Pillage!
Trade!
Leave!
A fishing village has been spotted!
A monastery has been spotted!
At first, the creaking of the longboat could have been anything… but as the creature got into sight, there could be no doubt. The Kraken!
Valhalla awaits!
Every man for himself!
A town has been spotted!
An armed merchant ship has been spotted!
Some of your less-than-loyal subjects have used the opportunity provided by you being on viking to try to seize power!
Why can't they let me have any fun?
With the ships heavy with gold and valuables, most of your men see no reason to continue on the raid…
Time to return to our farms!
Heavy with riches? NOT ANY MORE!
While you have claimed this title, you have yet to have the approval of the Tings, consisting of all freemen in the realms, to rule… The tings are in session.
I will make my case!
The majority of the Tings have approved your rule!
Hurrah!
The majority of the Tings have recognised other claimants to the throne!
I will claim my rule with the sword!
A group of powerful farmers, able to sway the Ting vote, have approached you and requested a small donation in return for their support to your claim…
A donation it is.
This land is mine by right! I refuse!
Your right to rule the lands of your liege have been recognised by some of the Tings!
To war!
Finally, the majority of the tings recognise your rightful claim to rule!
Hurrah!
Your title has changed, and the tings are re-convening to determine wether or not they support your claim.
Ok
Your respect among the chiefs has increased!
Hail Odin!
Your respect among the chiefs has decreased!
Damn Loke!
Your respect among the Godis has increased!
Hail Odin!
Your respect among the Godis has decreased!
Damn Loke!
Your respect among the townsfolk has increased!
Hail Odin!
Your respect among the townsfolk has decreased!
Damn Loke!
Maintenance event
Nothing to see here!

An opportunity to get rid of [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] has arised: With the excuse of a feast to reconcile me with my less loyal vassals, I could plan a little side entertainment not just to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim], but also to many other of my less appreciative and most sneaky subjects..
I'll invite them to a nice 'feast'
This isn't a good idea

Everything is planned for the 'feast': at my signal my guards will irrupt into the main hall and murder all the rebellious scum and their entourage. They will have no chance of escaping my plans if I'm careful enough..
Send out the invitations at once!
It's not such a good idea after all

My dear subject, I hereby invite you and your most loyal subjects to a feast in the name of reconciliating our past divergences and strengthening the realm. I hope you will come and be part of this historical occasion of peace and renaissance.
I'll come at once!
This feast sounds suspicious..
My liege,\n  I, [From.GetTitledName], won't be able to attend the feast due to unforeseen circumstances. I hope you won't mind my absence.\n Yours [Root.GetTitledName]
Damn!

The guests have arrived, and while the music plays and the bastards enjoy their last meal all my plans are ready to be enacted. My guards are sharpening their swords and axes only waiting for my signal..
Keep those blade sharpened
It's too risky!

Our liege [From.GetTitledName] welcomes us to the feast, the food was lavishly served and there is more women and cups than any man will ever wish.. I should diverge with [From.GetTitledName] more often!
I propose a toast for [From.GetTitledName]!
This is too good to be true..
[From.GetTitledName] has suddenly left the feast with a random excuse..
He's not that stupid after all
The rebels are drinking and whoring, and my men are ready to act..
There will be blood
I truly reconciled during this feast..
The feast was a trap! As soon as we drank and felt at ease [From.GetTitledName] ordered his men to murder us! It's a bloodbath!
Argh!
The feast is over, and we are on our way home. I really feel reconciled with [From.GetTitledName]!
What a great feast!
Armors were hacked while wind blew and howled: piles of corpses, piles of bodies, and a river of blood flowed! It is there!! It is time to charge!!
Not now! Fall back!
The stronger they are, the harder they fall!

The love of arms and the mad wickedness of war are raging: the battle inflame itself with multiple charges from every flank, orders are shouted and swords clash into armors and skulls alike. My men look at me with the bloody eyes of soldiers, asking me for an order that could sort the battle in our favor.
He who flies at the right time can fight again..
Charge!!

And many strokes, though with a little axe, hew down and fell the hardest-timbered oak: The battle is not lost yet, we still have a chance to win it with a blunt manouvre that could turn its destiny on our side!
A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings home full numbers.
Audaces fortuna iuvat!

As they charged through an open field towards the enemy lines, the enemy archers began to fire and plow and gather into the garner of death, as brave, and good, and pure spirits as the world ever saw. The twilight of evening had begun to gather as a precursor of the midnight darkness that was to envelop an epic clash..
Fall back!
Glory! Which gilds our sepulchre and embalms our name!

The general lifts the horn up to his mouth, then sets his lips and blows it with great force. The hills are high, the horn's voice loud and long. They hear it echoing full thirty leagues. The enemy and his companions hear it sound: Our men are in a battle!
I better stay behind the lines..
To me my men!

Watching from the the woods the Wallace and the Moray, as the English came with the Earl o' Surrey, ain by ain they crossed, oh the bridge was rumbling. As they onward came, O'er the Brig o' Stirling. The Wallace gave a shout, out his men came running, stubbed the English host, at the Brig o' Stirling, Cressingham turned round, the bridge was small and turning, Moray cut him down, On the Brig o' Stirling.
This battle is lost!
The valiant never taste of death but once!

As I cam on, an farther on, an doun an by Harlaw, they fell fu close on ilka side, sic fun ye never saw. They fell fu close on ilka side, sic fun ye never saw. For Hielan swords gied clash for clash, at the battle o' Harlaw. The Hielanmen, wi their lang swords, they laid on us fu sair, an they drave back our merry men, three acres breadth an mair.
Oh no, oh no, my brither dear, that thing maun never be!
Tak ye your good sword in your hand, An come your wa's wi me!

A riot! A petty discussion between one of our sergeants and a bowmen degenerated into a large scaled riot inside the camp! Some tents are on fire and some brave men surely lost their lives driven by the fumes of alcohol and stupidity..
Fire! Fire in the camp! The tents are on fire, and most of our provisions are menaced by a treacherous fire that sparked up from a careless campfire! We are doomed!
In the distance a banner rises strong and mighty, with a small army marching behind it: It's our arms, reinforcements have finally arrived!
The ignorant farmers think that your Divination has hurt their crops! Fools!
Fools!
A wanderer have told you that your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has commited a particular divination that has damaged the crops and killed the livestock!
It is just superstitious farmers…
Throw [From.GetHerHim] into the dungeon!
The weather, the animals, the rumours… All can be omens, and you know this is a good one!
Hail the Gods!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has given me an omen to…
Conquer! I must prepare for the future battles at once!
Prosper! I should make an investment!
Rule! Time to get the Chieftains under my banner!
Scheme! Now is the time to prepare for plots!
The weather, the animals, the rumours… All can be omens, and you know this is a bad one!
Hail the Gods!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has foreseen bad portents..
Oh no!

Hail the Gods!
Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has cured a local child of a seemingly lethal and cruel disease!
Good.
Really?

column3: Vous brisez facilement la garde de [FromFrom.GetBestName] et le mettez à terre. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] est à vos pieds, complètement à votre merci.

column2: Why won't you just DIE?!
column3: Pouquoi ne veux-tu pas juste CREVER?!

column2: [FromFrom.GetBestName] tries to fight back, but you force your way through, easily overpowering [FromFrom.GetHerHis] pathetic defense. You strike for [FromFrom.GetHerHis] heart with all your might!
column3: [FromFrom.GetBestName] tente de résister, mais vous imposez votre rythme, passant facilement à travers sa pathétique défense. De toute votre force, vous luttez pour avoir sa tête!

column2: DIE!
column3: MEURS!

column2: is slain!
column3: est tué!

column2: You try to hold [From.GetBestName] back, but [From.GetHerHis] onslaught is unstoppable! You only slip once, but once is all [From.GetSheHe] needs...
column3: Vous essayez de repousser [From.GetBestName], mais son attaque est imparable! Vous êtes déstabilisé pendant une seconde, et une seconde c'est tout ce dont [From.GetSheHe] a besoin...

column2: Aaaaargh!
column3: Aaaaargh!

column2: [From.GetBestName] crumples to the ground, lifeless. You wipe [From.GetHerHis] blood from your weapon. The deed is done. [From.GetSheHeCap] is dead.
column3: [From.GetBestName] gît à terre, sans vie. Vous essuyez son sang de votre arme. C'est fait. [From.GetSheHeCap] est mort.

column2: Requiescat in pace.
column3: Requiescat in pace.

column2: You and [FromFrom.GetBestName] sit atop your horses at opposite ends of the lists. Banners flap in the wind and the crowd looks on in rapt expectation. You brace yourself and ready your lance.
column3: Vous vous trouvez à l'extrémité de la lice, face à [FromFrom.GetBestName]. Vos chevaux s'ébrouent, les bannières claquent au vent et la foule silencieuse attend fébrilement. Vous abaissez votre bassinet et préparez votre lance.

column2: Charge!
column3: Charger!

column2: I'll drive my lance right through [FromFrom.GetHerHis] throat...
column3: Je vais diriger ma lance directement sur sa gorge…

column2: You and [From.GetBestName] sit atop your horses at opposite ends of the lists. Banners flap in the wind and the crowd looks on in rapt expectation. You brace yourself and ready your lance.
column3: Vous vous trouvez à l'extrémité de la lice, face à [FromFrom.GetBestName]. Vos chevaux s'ébrouent, les bannières claquent au vent et la foule silencieuse attend fébrilement. Vous abaissez votre bassinet et préparez votre lance.

column2: Charge!
column3: Charger!

column2: I'll drive my lance right through [From.GetHerHis] throat...
column3: Je vais directement frapper sa gorge…

column2: The crowd roars and hooves beat against the dirt. You lean into your charge, lance extended forward, sweat dripping from your brow. For a moment, the tension grips you completely. And then you feel the shock run down your arm, as your lances crashes into your opponent!
column3: La foule rugit tandis que les sabots martèlent la lice. Vous vous penchez sur votre monture, la lance en avant, une goutte de sueur perle le long de votre cou. Un moment la tension s'empare de vous, puis vous sentez le choc à travers votre bras alors que votre lance frappe votre adversaire.

column2: Raaagh!
column3: Aaaaah!

column2: is struck!
column3: est frappé!

column2: The crowd roars and hooves beat against the dirt. You lean into your charge, lance extended forward, sweat dripping from your brow. For a moment, the tension grips you completely. And then you feel the shock as your opponent's lance crashes into you!
column3: La foule rugit tandis que les sabots martèlent la lice. Vous vous penchez sur votre monture, la lance en avant, une goutte de sueur perle le long de votre cou. Un moment la tension s'empare de vous, puis vous sentez le choc alors que la lance de votre adversaire vous frappe!

column2: Aaargh!
column3: Aaargh!

column2: Your lance smashes into [FromFrom.GetBestName]'s shield, and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] topples from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] horse. You slow your horse to a trot and turn, raising your lance into the sky while the crowd cheers your victory.
column3: Votre lance se brise sur le bouclier de [FromFrom.GetBestName] qui est jeté à bas de son cheval. Vous mettez votre cheval au trot puis faîtes demi-tour au bout de la lice, levant votre lance au ciel tandis que la foule acclame votre victoire.

column2: Victory!
column3: Victoire!

column2: is defeated.
column3: est défait.

column2: [From.GetBestName]'s lance smashes into your shield, and you try to cling to your horse, but the force is too much. You are thrown from the saddle, and are left in the dirt as the crowd cheers for [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s victory.
column3: La lance de [From.GetBestName] se brise sur votre bouclier, vous tentez désespéremment de rester en selle mais le choc est trop fort. Vous êtes désarçonné et vous écrasez au sol tandis que la foule acclame la victorie de [From.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: Curses!
column3: Malédiction!

column2: [FromFrom.GetBestName] tries to take the blow on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] shield, but your lance slips past, driving hard into [FromFrom.GetHerHis] neck. The wood cracks and your opponent slips from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] horse and lies in the dirt, slowly dying in a pool of [FromFrom.GetHerHis] own blood. You have won, but at what cost?
column3: [FromFrom.GetBestName] tente de prendre le coup sur son bouclier, mais votre lance dévie et le frappe violemment au cou. Le bois craque et votre adversaire chute de son cheval. A terre, il agonise, s'etouffant dans son propre sang. Vous avez gagné, mais à quel prix?

column2: Such a tragedy...
column3: Quelle tragédie…

column2: is slain!
column3: est tué!

column2: You try to take the blow on your shield, but it slips past. You have just time enough time to fill with horror before the great wooden spear drives itself into your throat, and everything goes dark.
column3: Vous essayez de prendre le coup sur votre bouclier mais elle dévie. Vous avez juste le temps de lâcher un cri avant que la grande lance de bois ne frappe votre gorge, et tout devient noir.

column2: Aaaaargh!
column3: Aaaaargh!

column2: is victorious!
column3: est victorieux!

column2: The fight is over. [From.GetBestName] lies defeated. You have won!
column3: Le combat est terminé. [From.GetBestName] est vaincu. Vous avez gagné!

column2: Victory is mine!
column3: La victoire est mienne!

column2: Fighting across the field, you see an enemy soldier cut off from the others. While you can't tell who, it's clear that they must be a highborn noble.
column3: Alors que vous vous battez sur le champs de bataille, vous apercevez un soldat ennemi s'extirper des rangs. Si vous n'arrivez pas à voir de qui il s'agit, vous êtes par contre sûr qu'il s'agit d'un noble de haute naissance.

column2: Charge!
column3: Charger!

column2: You were seperated from your men in the chaos of battle, and now find yourself in the midst of war. As you scan the field and try to rejoin your forces, you see [From.GetBestName] break through the enemy ranks and charge you!
column3: Dans le chaos des combats, vous avez été séparé de vos hommes et vous trouvez désormais en plein milieu de la bataille. Alors que vous tentez de rejoindre vos forces, vous apercevez [From.GetBestName] qui se fraye un chemin à travers les rangs ennemis avant de vous charger!

column2: Prepare to die, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] scum!
column3: Prépare toi à mourir, pourriture de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]!

column2: I need to get out of here!

column2: Prepare to die, [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] scum!
column3: Prépare toi à mourir, pourriture de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]!

column2: I need to get out of here!
